thread.title: Winter storm Niko is causing many Northeast colleges to close
thread.title_full: Winter storm Niko is causing many Northeast colleges to close

author: USATODAY College
title: Winter storm Niko is causing many Northeast colleges to close

organizations.name: st. francis college st. francis college

text:
— Lehman College (@LehmanCollege) February 9, 2017 
Bentley University 
— Bentley University (@bentleyu) February 9, 2017 
Monmouth University Monmouth University will be closed on February 9, 2017. Classes are canceled. Non-essential personnel are not required to report to work. pic.twitter.com/6sBRAgt4bQ 
— Monmouth University (@monmouthu) February 9, 2017 
Boston College BC Weather Alert. Because of the storm forecast, Boston College will be closed on Thursday, February 9. 
— Boston College (@BostonCollege) February 9, 2017 
La Salle University #LaSalleU will be closed tomorrow 2/9 and day classes are canceled. A decision about evening classes will be made by 10am. 
— La Salle University (@LaSalleUniv) February 8, 2017 
University of Victoria Feb 8 at 1:47pm: UVic is closed due to extreme weather conditions. Check this page for updates: https://t.co/7Wn3la9wou 
— UniversityOfVictoria (@uvic) February 8, 2017 
Framingham State WEATHER ALERT: Due to the impending snow storm, FSU will be closed on Thursday, Feb. 9th. Both day and evening classes are cancelled. 
— Framingham State (@FraminghamU) February 9, 2017 
Bergen Community College WEATHER UPDATE: Due to the winter storm, all Bergen Community College locations will be closed from Thursday,… https://t.co/EN0dLqc7tn 
— BergenCC (@BergenCC) February 9, 2017 
Curry College Due to the Winter Storm Warning, Curry is closed tomorrow, Thurs., Feb. 9. All classes are cancelled & offices closed in Milton/Plymouth. ❄️ 
— Curry College (@CurryEdu) February 9, 2017 
Brooklyn College Due to severe weather Brooklyn College will be closed tomorrow Feb 9th. Check https://t.co/jCjT9Bb47p for updates and info. 
— Brooklyn College (@BklynCollege411) February 9, 2017 
St. Francis College St. Francis College will be closed on Thursday, February 9th due to severe winter weather conditions. We will… https://t.co/z8pgsyiMWQ 
— St. Francis College (@SFCNY) February 9, 2017 
Emmanuel College All Emmanuel day and evening classes on Thursday, February 9 are canceled and offices will be closed. 
— Emmanuel College (@EmmanuelCollege) February 8, 2017 
Douglas College Due to a severe winter storm forecast, all Douglas College campuses will be CLOSED as of 2:30 pm today. Visit the website for more info. 
— Douglas College (@douglascollege) February 8, 2017 
Fitchburg State FSU Alert: Due to inclement weather, the University is closed Thursday February 9, 2017, and both day and evening classes are cancelled. 
— Fitchburg State (@Fitchburg_State) February 9, 2017 
Many college students affected by the cancellations took to Twitter to express their excitement over a snow day: When everyone gets the "University is closed text" at the same time and start yelling and clapping in the cafeteria! 
— Sophia Pardo (@ItsChloeeexo) February 9, 2017 Me bc the university is closed tomorrow pic.twitter.com/S9R7vC5JoG 
— the fork on the left (@THEAlexLemma) February 9, 2017 The whole university closed tomorrow. CAASHH ME IN BED. 
— Taylore Robinson (@tayloreerob) February 9, 2017 When you get that "the university is closed tomorrow" text pic.twitter.com/1H2TO20fKQ 
— Kween K (@forevrkimmy) February 9, 2017 
If you know of a school we missed that should be on the list, please tweet us @USATODAYCollege . 
Over 2,300 flights have been cancelled due to the storm, with many airlines waiving fees for travelers making flight changes. 
The Weather Channel’s name of the storm is “short for the Greek name Nikolaos, which means “victor of the people or people’s champion,” according to their storm tracking page . 
If you’re a college student in the affected area, stay safe and warm as Niko passes. Facebook is now offering emergency assistance to those in need through its Safety Check feature if you find yourself in a life-threatening situation throughout the storm. 
Have a happy snow day! Enjoy! (Giphy) Chelsie Arnold is a student at Eastern New Mexico University and a USA TODAY College digital producer.
